com.ikalagaming.packages

Interface Package

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BasePackage, Console, LoggingPackage, PackageManager

    public interface Package
    A distinct chunk of the program with a specific purpose and methods for managing its state and interacting with the main program.
    Author:
    Ches Burks

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean disable()
      Deactivates the package and halts all of its operations.
      boolean enable()
      Activates the package and enables it to perform its normal functions.
      java.util.Set<Listener> getListeners()
      Returns a list of listeners for this package.

      Returns the type of package this is.
      PackageState getPackageState()
      Returns the current state of the package.
      double getVersion()
      Returns this classes version number.
      boolean isEnabled()
      Returns true if the package is enabled, and false otherwise.

      This method is called when the package is enabled.

      Called when the package is loaded into memory.

      boolean reload()
      This is essentially restarting the package.
      void setPackageState(PackageState newState)
      Sets the current state of the package.

    • Method Detail

      • disable

        boolean disable()
        Deactivates the package and halts all of its operations. The package is still loaded in memory but not active. Calls onDisable(). This should change the packages state to DISABLING. If the disabling were done here and not in the onDisable() method, the package state should be changed to DISABLED after completion. Otherwise the change to DISABLED is handled in the onDisable method.
        Returns:
        true if the package has been successfully disabled

      • enable

        boolean enable()
        Activates the package and enables it to perform its normal functions. Calls onEnable(). This should change the package state to ENABLING. If the enabling were done here and not in the onEnable() method, the package state should be changed to ENABLED after completion. Otherwise the change to ENABLED is handled in the onEnable method.
        Returns:
        true if the package was successfully enabled

      • getListeners

        java.util.Set<Listener> getListeners()
        Returns a list of listeners for this package. These listeners will be used with the event system.
        Returns:
        a list of listeners for the package.

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the type of package this is. This is a string that describes the package, such as "Graphics" or "AI".
        Returns:
        a string descriptor of the package

      • getPackageState

        PackageState getPackageState()
        Returns the current state of the package. This should be updated as the package is interacted with, and is recommended to default to DISABLED if the state is not set yet. This is to prevent the package from being accessed inappropriately.
        Returns:
        a PackageState representing the status of this package

      • getVersion

        double getVersion()
        Returns this classes version number. This changes periodically for each package subclass as they are changed and updated.
        Returns:
        the version

      • isEnabled

        boolean isEnabled()
        Returns true if the package is enabled, and false otherwise. A state of ENABLED returns true, any other states will return false.
        Returns:
        true if the package is fully ready to operate

      • onDisable

        void onDisable()
        This method is called when the package is disabled, and gives the package the chance to shut itself down and save any changes made in memory to disk if necessary. After the package is done disabling, the package state should be changed to DISABLED.

      • onEnable

        void onEnable()
        This method is called when the package is enabled. Initialization should be performed here, and configuration and data should be loaded from disk if necessary. After the package is done setting up and is ready to be used, the package state should be changed to ENABLED.

      • onLoad

        void onLoad()
        Called when the package is loaded into memory. The package may or may not be enabled at this time. The Package State should be set to PackageState.LOADING just before loading has started. After it is fully loaded, it should be enabled based on the value of PackageSettings.ENABLE_ON_LOAD. If it is not enabled then the package state should be set to PackageState.DISABLED.

      • onUnload

        void onUnload()
        Called when the package is unloaded from memory. If it is enabled, then the package should disable itself now. The Package State should be set to UNLOADING just before unloading has started. Any memory that can reasonably be dereferenced by the package itself, should be. Files may be saved to disk if needed. After completion of the unloading, the Package State should be set to PENDING_REMOVAL.

      • reload

        boolean reload()
        This is essentially restarting the package. The general flow is as follows:
        1. If the package is enabled , disable it by calling disable().
        2. Set the Package State to UNLOADING and perform the operations onUnload() carries out. A Package state of PENDING_REMOVAL is not used as the framework should stay loaded. This should return the package to a fresh state, as it would appear during the first time loading just before onLoad() is called
        3. Loading the package by calling onLoad() or performing the operations it carries out which are applicable at this time
        4. The package is enabled using enable()
        Returns:
        true if the package reloaded successfully

      • setPackageState

        void setPackageState(PackageState newState)
        Sets the current state of the package. This should be used to update the package state as it is interacted with, This exists to assist with thread safety.
        Parameters:
        newState - The state the package should now be
